item.title: Report E-2025040546
item.description:
Report E-2025040546

Identified by scraper @ 2025-05-07T21:14:44+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-03-26
  • City: ROMULUS
  • State: MI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 00:19 EDT on 3/26, XPO-XDE contacted ERTS to report a spill of about 10 gallons of "OEB 9658 Emulsion Breaker" from a 550-gallon metal tote onto the trailer and dock floors. The tote tipped over during unloading and spilled from the unsecured lid. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller, who felt comfortable cleaning the spill with terminal-issued PPE. The lid was re-secured to the tote and shipped on. ERTS generated waste ID: 231745-1 ERTS reported the spill to Chemtrec and spoke to Esta who provided report number: 2025032600002

THIS PACKAGE WAS SHIPPED FROM MICHIGAN USING UPS ACCOUNT NUMBER E49099, UM COLLEGE OF PHARMACY, 428 CHURCH ST, ANN ARBOR MI 48109-1065.

item.title: Report E-2025040012
item.description:
Report E-2025040012

Identified by scraper @ 2025-05-06T01:06:02+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-03-31
  • City: WHITMORE LAKE
  • State: MI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO-Logistics contacted ERTS regarding a leaking 275-gallon tote containing hazardous product, Scale Trol-G. A contractor dispatched and observed an estimated 1-gallon release onto the top of the tote and onto the wooden trailer floor in a 4’ x 4’ area as a result of improper packaging – a faulty cap on the tote. The contractor replaced the cap on the tote and performed a slosh test. The tote passed and was shipped on to the consignee. The release was cleaned up with Kolor Safe neutralizer and absorbent rags. One 30-gallon DF of waste was generated containing the neutralized, impacted rags. XPO will manage all waste generated from the response. No storm-drains, waterways, or soil were involved in this incident.

item.title: Report E-2025040046
item.description:
Report E-2025040046

Identified by scraper @ 2025-05-06T01:06:02+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-03-27
  • City: FLINT
  • State: MI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ESTES EXPRESS LINES
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 12000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Clean Harbors personnel arrived onsite and observed an estimated two (2) cups of material released from one (1) 5-gallon plastic jug. The material released impacted multiple areas in the trailer. A neutralizer was deployed while cleaning the trailer. Clean Harbors personnel began transferring the product in the remaining containers into IBC plastic totes. A total of three totes were used to transfer the material. All the empty containers from the transferred product were placed into eight poly-lined cubic yard boxes. Four (4) 55-gallon poly drums and two (2) 30-gallon poly drums of impacted absorbents and PPE were also generated from the spill. The generated waste was staged onsite and will remain onsite for the ESTES DGRM team to coordinate disposal. The ESTES terminal supervisor approved all work before Clean Harbors departed

item.title: Report E-2025040088
item.description:
Report E-2025040088

Identified by scraper @ 2025-05-06T01:06:02+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-03-03
  • City: GRAND RAPIDS
  • State: MI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 21:30 EST on 3/3, XPO-XGR contacted ERTS to report a spill of about 2 gallons of "1.4 Low VOC Cleaner" from 4x 1-gallon metal pails on the dock floor. The box was punctured by a forklift at XGR. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and determined the terminal did not have sufficient PPE to clean the spill, citing goggles. ERTS will dispatch a contractor to assist. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 1-gallon of UN1263 1.4 Low VOC Cleaner product released impacting 2’x4’ area of the dock floor due to forklift puncture. The crew restacked the pallet and wiped down the other products which had been impacted by the spill. There was (1) 1-gallon bottle found damaged and the other 3 in the punctured box were not damaged. The waste was collected into (1) 55-gallon metal drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.
